intro: Floscopa tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf floscopa, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dark green, rough-textured leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
